channel.title: Projects on AP Research
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on AP Research

item.title: AP Research Docs
item.description: Password protected. Please do not disseminate documents shared in this link.

item.title: Oral Defense Questions
item.description: Taken from pages 52–53 of the AP Research Course and Exam Description.

item.title: AP Capstone Implementation Guide
item.description: Please read the AP Capstone Plagiarism and Falsification or Fabrication of Information policy on page 14.

item.title: AP Classroom
item.description: Log in with your College Board student account. Click Join a Course or Exam. Submit join code, which you will receive from your teacher.

item.title: AP Digital Portfolio
item.description: Access EBSCO and Turnitin through AP Digital Portfolio. Deadline to submit academic paper to the AP Digital Portfolio is April 30, 2020, at 11:59 p.m. ET. To avoid last-minute tech issues, our class will be submitting papers a few days earlier.

item.title: AP Research Course and Exam Description
Inquiry Proposal Form
item.description: Due on October 30. Must receive teacher approval of this completed form before conducting research.

item.title: Research Proposal
item.description: Due on November 30. After your inquiry proposal form is approved, complete a research proposal for approval before proceeding to your academic paper.

item.title: Reproducible Research
item.description: Minimal example of code, data documentation, and integration with paper.
